content.text:
[@Nick Redmark](@zEbr4oS0j1O41UYGBVbay+4NvAc2yfJi43yW3Yx28BI=.ed25519) 

I'll often `mv ~/.ssb ~/.ssb.bak` to use a new ephemeral feed and then `rm -rf ~/.ssb && mv ~/.ssb.bak ~/.ssb` to delete it and go back to my primary feed, but it's not really a best practice. I think `ssb-server` also takes a `--path` flag, so you could do `ssb-server --path ~/.ssb-other-id`, but it requires that that other ID is already set up.

What's your use-case for having another feed? Just testing stuff out? I'd love to help if there's a problem you're trying to solve.
